intro: Kayea navesii, commonly known as the Hawaiian whitebeam, is a flowering plant native to the island of Kauaʻi in Hawaii. It is a member of the Elaeocarpaceae family and is characterized by its small, white flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas within rainforests, often found along stream banks and in valleys. Kayea navesii is known for its ecological importance, providing habitat and food for native insect species. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a critically endangered species, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
